summary: This is a U.S. Department of Justice foreign travel questionnaire form, partially completed for a USAO-SDNY employee traveling on official business related to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The purpose of travel is to interview and debrief a witness, and the document identifies Ghislaine Maxwell as a subject of the investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The case name is listed as 'In re Jeffrey Epstein' and is the subject of the ongoing investigation for which the travel is being conducted.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as a subject of the investigation, believed to be a citizen of the United States, the United Kingdom, and France.

connections.description: Both are listed as subjects of the same ongoing investigation (USAO # 2018R01618).

events.title: Epstein Investigation Ongoing
events.description: The document references an ongoing and very sensitive investigation into Jeffrey Epstein, with case number USAO # 2018R01618.

events.title: Planned Foreign Travel for Witness Interview
events.description: A USAO-SDNY employee is planning official foreign travel for the purpose of interviewing and debriefing a witness in the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document is a U.S. Department of Justice foreign travel questionnaire, indicating official U.S. government travel related to the Epstein investigation.
The case is identified as 'In re Jeffrey Epstein', USAO number 2018R01618, and is described as an ongoing and very sensitive investigation.
Ghislaine Maxwell is explicitly named as a subject of the investigation alongside Jeffrey Epstein.
The purpose of the travel is to interview and debrief a witness, though the witness's name is not provided in the form.
The form indicates that foreign authorities have been contacted and are prepared to cooperate with the U.S. officials' travel and activities.
